title: Heavy rainfall likely in several provinces
byline: The Meteorology Department says that showers or thundershowers will occur at most places of the island during the afternoon or night.

title: EU seeks unity in first strike back at Trump tariffs
byline: European Union countries will seek to present a united front in the coming days against U.S. President Donald Trump’s tariffs, likely approving a first set of targeted countermeasures on up to $28 billion of U.S. imports from dental floss to diamonds.

title: LG Polls: EC to hand over postal ballots to Dept. of Posts
byline: The Election Commission has stated that arrangements will be made to hand over the reserved packets containing the registered postal ballot papers for 114 Local Government institutions to the Postal Department today (07).

title: Meta releases new AI model Llama 4
byline: Meta Platforms on Saturday released the latest version of its large language model (LLM) Llama, called the Llama 4 Scout and Llama 4 Maverick.

title: Asian markets plunge as Trump’s global tariff turmoil deepens
byline: Asian markets plunged on Monday, deepening a global stocks rout triggered by US President Donald Trump’s trade war.

title: World Health Day commemorated today
byline: The World Health Day is commemorated today.

title: CAA to inspect food outlets that cater to long-distance bus passengers
byline: Bus operators have urged health authorities to inspect the quality of food and other services provided by outlets that are used by long-distance passenger transport buses.

title: Namal Rajapaksa arrives at CID to record statement
byline: Sri Lanka Podujana Peramuna (SLPP) Member of Parliament Namal Rajapaksa has arrived at the Criminal Investigation Department to record a statement, Ada Derana reporter said.

title: CSE temporarily halts regular trading
byline: Regular trading at the Colombo Stock Exchange has been halted due to the S&P SL20 index dropping over 5 per cent from the previous close.

title: Saudi Arabia bans visas for 14 countries including India, Pakistan, Bangladesh
byline: Saudi Arabia has temporarily suspended issuance of visas to citizens from 14 countries, including India, Pakistan and Bangladesh, as per media reports.

title: Mahinda Rajapaksa is in good health, confirms Namal amid rumors
byline: Sri Lanka Podujana Peramuna (SLPP) Member of Parliament Namal Rajapaksa dismissed recent rumors circulating on social media regarding the health of his father, former President Mahinda Rajapaksa.

title: Jay North, TV’s mischievous Dennis the Menace, dies at 73
byline: Jay North, who starred as the towheaded mischief maker on TV’s “Dennis the Menace” for four seasons starting in 1959, has died. He was 73.

title: Sri Lanka records nearly 230,000 tourist arrivals in March
byline: Sri Lanka has welcomed 229,298 tourists in the month of March, the Sri Lanka Tourism Development Authority (SLTDA) confirmed.

title: Namal leaves CID after recording brief statement
byline: Sri Lanka Podujana Peramuna (SLPP) Member of Parliament Namal Rajapaksa has left the Criminal Investigation Department (CID) after recording a brief statement, Ada Derana reporter said.

title: Jordanian man allegedly attempted to open plane door on flight to Sydney
byline: A Jordanian national allegedly attempted to open the doors of a Sydney-bound plane on Saturday evening and had to be restrained by crew and other passengers, forcing the airline to request police assistance on arrival.

title: No benefit for Tamil Nadu from Modi’s Sri Lanka visit: CM Stalin
byline: The recent visit of Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi to Sri Lanka did not benefit Tamil Nadu, according to Chief Minister M.K. Stalin.

title: Central Bank presents 2024 Annual Economic Review to President
byline: The Central Bank of Sri Lanka today (07) presented its flagship publication, the Annual Economic Review for 2024 (AER 2024), to the President and Minister of Finance, Anura Kumara Dissanayake, highlighting the steady progress of Sri Lanka’s economic recovery following the country’s most severe downturn in recent history.

title: President receives “Census of Population and Housing 2024” report
byline: The report of the “Census of Population and Housing 2024,” conducted by the Department of Census and Statistics, has been officially handed over to President Anura Kumara Dissanayake this morning (07) at the Presidential Secretariat.

title: Sri Lanka and India must continue expanding defence and security collaboration: Dy. Minister
byline: Sri Lanka and India must continue expanding the defence and security collaboration, particularly in addressing emerging threats such as maritime security challenges, drug trafficking, transnational crimes, and climate change, says Deputy Minister of Defence Major General (Retd) Aruna Jayasekara.

title: MP Chamara Sampath further remanded
byline: New Democratic Front (NDF) Parliamentarian Chamara Sampath Dassanayake has been further remanded until 21 April by the Badulla Magistrate’s Court.

title: Legal challenges to delay elections for several LG bodies?
byline: The National Election Commission must conduct elections for all local government bodies before June 2, Rohana Hettiarachchi, Executive Director of People’s Action for Free & Fair Elections (PAFFREL) said.

title: Ex-President Maithripala Sirisena arrives at CID
byline: Former President Maithripala Sirisena has arrived at the Criminal Investigation Department (CID) to provide a statement, Ada Derana reporter said.

title: EC notified of vacant MP seat after Kosala Nuwan’s death
byline: The Parliament of Sri Lanka has informed the Election Commission in writing that a parliamentary seat has fallen vacant following the demise of National People’s Power (NPP) Kegalle District MP Kosala Nuwan Jayaweera, the Communications Department of Parliament said.

title: Shadows disappear as Colombo witnesses rare ‘Zero Shadow Day’
byline: Residents of Colombo witnessed a rare astronomical event at exactly 12.12 p.m. today (April 07) as their shadows vanished momentarily under the midday sun.

title: Oil prices drop to lowest in four years
byline: Oil slid around 3% on Monday to its weakest since 2021, while most commodity markets including metals tumbled as an intensifying trade war between the United States and China triggered worries over demand for raw materials.

title: Election-related complaints climb ahead of 2025 LG Polls
byline: A total of nine new complaints have been reported in relation to acts of violence and violations of election laws pertaining with the 2025 Local Government (LG) Election, according to Police.

title: North India bracing for extreme heat
byline: India’s weather department has warned of high temperatures in parts of northern India, including capital Delhi, for this week.

title: ASPI drops over 700 points to fall below 15,000-mark
byline: The All Share Price Index (ASPI) of the Colombo Stock Exchange (CSE) dropped below the 15,000-point mark after losing more than 700 points during today’s trading.

title: Met Dept. issues warning for severe lightning in three provinces
byline: Thundershowers accompanied by severe lightning are likely to occur at several places in the Sabaragamuwa, Central and Uva provinces and in the Hambantota district, the Department of Meteorology warns.

title: Sri Lanka’s population reaches 21.76 million - Census 2024 reveals
byline: The Census of Population and Housing 2024 has found that the latest population of Sri Lanka is 21,763,170.

title: Jacqueline Fernandez’s mother Kim Fernandez dies after suffering a stroke
byline: Jacqueline Fernandez’s mother, Kim Fernandez, has died after suffering a stroke on Sunday.

title: Stay order issued on poll-related activities of several LG bodies including CMC
byline: The Court of Appeal today (07) issued a stay order preventing any further action in relation to the conduct of elections for several local government authorities, including the Colombo Municipal Council (CMC).

title: Adani Group’s Colombo Terminal commences operations
byline: Adani Ports and Special Economic Zone Ltd (APSEZ) has announced the commencement of operations at the Colombo West International Terminal (CWIT), located at the Port of Colombo.

title: President meets IMF delegation to discuss Sri Lanka’s fourth review
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake has held discussions with the representatives of the International Monetary Fund (IMF) this morning (07) at the Presidential Secretariat.

title: Ex-President Maithripala leaves CID after giving statement
byline: Former President Maithripala Sirisena has left the Criminal Investigation Department (CID) after providing a statement for around four hours, Ada Derana reporter said.

title: Sri Lanka’s foreign reserves surge to USD 6.51 billion in March
byline: Sri Lanka’s official foreign reserves rose sharply in March 2025, reaching US$6.51 billion, according to the latest data released by the Central Bank of Sri Lanka (CBSL).

title: Sri Lanka’s Foreign Minister meets US envoy to discuss new trade tariffs
byline: Sri Lanka’s Minister of Foreign Affairs Vijitha Herath has held a discussion with United States Ambassador to Sri Lanka Julie Chung regarding the new trade tariffs imposed on the country’s exports to the US.

title: Opposition Leader blames govt inaction on US tariffs as CSE plunges
byline: Highlighting the performance of the Colombo Stock Exchange (CSE) today (07), Leader of the Opposition Sajith Premadasa claimed that Sri Lankan citizens are paying the price for the government’s unwillingness to heed the opposition’s advice regarding US reciprocal tariffs imposed on the country’s exports.

title: Sri Lanka fashion sector praises government response to US tariffs
byline: Sri Lanka’s government formed a working group aimed at evaluating the repercussions of the US’ tariffs on Sri Lanka goods, which will impact its fashion export sector.
